TEXT.TITLE: U.S. SELLING 17 BILLION DLRS OF 9-, 20-DAY BILLS
TEXT.BODY: The U.S. Treasury said it will auction 17 billion dlrs of 9-day and 20-day cash management bills on April 2. The auction will consist of 11 billion dlrs in 9-day bills and six billion dlrs in 20-day bills. Bids for the bills will be received at all Federal Reserve Banks and branches. Tenders must be for a minimum of one mln dlrs, and non-competitive tenders from the public will not be accepted. Bids will not be received at the Treasury Department. The 9-day bills will be issued April 7 and mature April 16, while the 20-day bills will be issued April 3 and mature April 23. Reuter
